intro: Primula calycina var. longobarda, commonly known as the long-stemmed primrose, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It features showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow, often with a distinctive dark red or purple throat. The plant typically grows to a height of 15–30 cm, with hairy stems and heart-shaped, dark green leaves. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in woodland or rocky habitats. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for garden cultivation in temperate climates.
